property.value: The Alu-Demon is immune to the Electricity, Fire, and Poison traits. Succeed at an Arcane or Divine 10 check or you may not play Attack spells. If undefeated, the Alu-Demon deals no damage; instead, bury a blessing of your choice from your hand, or bury your entire hand if you have no blessings. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.
"Tread not upon the frozen stones, lest Freezemaw see and steal your bones." -- Tamiir-Quah Shoanti warning

Before the encounter, each character at this location attempts a Dexterity or Acrobatics 12 check. Characters who succeed are dealt 1 Cold damage; characters who fail are dealt 1d4 Cold damage. If Arkrhyst escapes, return him to the location where you encountered him.
"Who will not know my name? For I am forever!" -- Azaven the Lich

Azaven is immune to the Cold, Electricity, Mental, and Poison traits. Before the encounter, attempt a Constitution or Fortitude 12 check. If you succeed, discard 1 card from your deck; if you fail, discard 1d4+1 cards from your deck. All damage dealt by Azaven is Cold damage.
You may not play spells with the Attack trait. If undefeated, after the encounter, bury your discard pile.
If undefeated, each character at this location must succeed at a Dexterity or Acrobatics 12 check or be dealt 1d4+1 Combat damage.
If your check to defeate the Disjunction Pulse fails by 3 or more, each character at this location must recharge every card with the Magic trait in her hand.
The Elemental is immune to the Mental and Poison traits. If undefeated, put the Elemental on the bottom of the location deck.
The elemental is immune to the Mental and Poison traits. If undefeated, you move to a random other location.

Highlady Athroxis is immune to the Fire trait. Before the encounter, Highlady Athroxis deals 1 Fire damage to you. After the encounter, Highlady Athroxis deals 1 Fire damage to you. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.

Before the encounter, each character at your location must succeed at a Wisdom 10 check or the difficulty of his checks is increased by 2 for the rest of the turn. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.

You may not play spells with the Attack trait. Before the encounter the Golem deals 1d4-1 damage to a random character at this location. Roll 1d4 for the type of damage: 1. Cold 2. Electricity 3. FIre 4. Ranged Combat

Before you encounter Jordimandus, summon and encounter a random monster. If you defeat that monster, you may discard a weapon or a spell with the Attack trait to attempt a Diplomacy 14 check to defeat Jordimandus. If you fail, Jordimandus is undefeated, and deals Mental damage that may not be reduced. If undefeated, a random character at this location takes 1d4+1 Acid damage.

"But fear not. Your sons' gilded corpses will be returned. Let them be an enduring reminder, both of precision's necessity and that all things within this domain belong to me." -- Karzoug, Runelord of Greed, to his vaultkeeper.
The Karzoug Statue is immune to the Attack and Mental traits. If undefeated, each character at this location takes 1d4-1 Combat damage; do not reset your hand at the end of the turn.

Mistress Delvahine is immune to the Electricity, Fire, and Poison traits. Succeed at an Arcane or Divine 12 check or you may not play spells with the Attack trait. Before the encounter, succeed at a Wisdom 12 check or a random character at your location takes Combat damage equal to the number of spells with the Attack trait and weapons in your hand. If undefeated, Delvahine does not deal damage. Instead, bury a random blessing from your hand, or bury your entire hand if you have no blessings.
The Mummy is immune to the Cold, Mental, and Poison traits. Add 1d8 to checks to defeat the Mummy with the Fire trait. If undefeated, after the encounter, bury your discard pile.
If undefeated, each character at this location discards 1d4+1 cards of his choice; put this card under the top card (if any) of the location deck.

Whenever Ordikon deals damage, roll 1d4 for the type of damage: 1. Acid 2. Electricity 3. Fire 4. Poison The first time you defeat Ordikon this turn, roll 1d6; on a 1 or 2, Ordikon is undefeated, and you immediately encounter him again.

The Shining Child is immune to the Fire and Poison traits.
All damage dealt by the Shining Child is Fire damage.

Before the encounter, succeed at a Wisdom 10 check or recharge your hand and draw 1 card. All damage dealt by the Simulacrum is Mental damage that may not be reduced. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.
Damage dealt by the Sinspawn Axeman is increased by 1d4-1.

You may bury a spell to defeat the Stone Head. If you defeat it any other way, the Stone Head delas 1d4-1 Electricity damage to each character at this location. If undefeated, you may return the Stone Head to the top of this location deck. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.

The Succubus is immune to the Electricity, Fire, and Poison traits. Succeed at an Arcane or Divine 10 check or you may not play spells with the Attack trait. If undefeated, the Succubus deals no damage; instead, bury a blessing of your choice from your hand, or bury your entire hand if you have no blessings.
"What happened to Thassilon? What became of Runelord Karzoug and Runelord Alaznist?" -- The Scribbler
Before the encounter, each character at this location summons and encounters a random monster. The first time in this scenario that anyone would defeat the Scribbler, he is undefeated.
If defeated, add 1d4 random spells from the box to your hand. If undefeated, each character at this location is dealt 2d4 fire damage; banish this card.

The Treachery Demon may not be evaded, and is immune to the Electricity and Poison traits. Before the encounter, succeed at a Wisdom 12 check or a random character at this location takes an amount of Combat damage equal to the number of spells with the Attack trait and weapons in your hand.

Before the encounter, each character at your location must succeed at a Dexterity or Acrobatics 12 check or be dealt 1 Fire damage. If undefeated, the Warrior of Wrath deals 1d4 Force damage to a random character at your location. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.

Xyoddin Xerriock is immune to the Mental and Poison traits. If your character has the Human trait, the difficulty to defeat Xyoddin Xerriock is increased by 3. If undefeated, the damage dealt by Xyoddin Xerriock is increased by 2. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.
For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Dexterity or Ranged die + 1d6+3; you may additionally discard this card to add another 3d4 with the acid trait.

Place this card in front of you when a character encounters a bane. Any character who encounters a monster this turn adds 2d6 with the Cold trait to her combat check. Discard this card at the end of this turn, and every other character takes 1 Cold damage. If you do not have the Arcane skill, banish this card.
Succeed at an Arcane 14 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.
Light Armor Magic

Recharge this card to reduce Combat damage dealt to you by 2. You may draw up to 2 cards. Banish this card to reduce all damage dealt to you to 0; if you are proficient with light armors, bury this card instead. If you are proficient with light armors, you may recharge this card when you reset your hand.

For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Strength of Melee die + 1d6+2; you may additionally recharge this card to add another 1d6+2. If you aren't proficient with weapons, the difficulty of this check is increased by 4. When playing another weapon, you may discard this card to add 1d6+2 to the combat check.

For your combat check, discard this card to roll your Arcane die + 4d6. If you defeat a non-Villain monster when playing this spell, banish that monster, even if it would otherwise be undefeated. Discard this card to defeat a barrier with the Lock or Obstacle trait. If you do not have the Arcane skill, banish this card.
Succeed at an Arcane 16 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.
Recharge this card to add 1d6+1 with the Magic trait to your Ranged combat check. Discard this card to explore your location.

For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Strength or Melee die + 2d4+2; you may additionally discard this card to add another 2d4. If you aren't proficient with weapons, the difficulty of this check is increased by 4. If any d4 rolled using this weapon is a 4, count it as 6.

For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Strength or Melee die + 2d4+3; you may additionally discard this card to add another 1d10 with the Fire trait. If you aren't proficient with weapons, the difficiulty of this check is increased by 4. If you fail a combat check with this weapon, you may discard this card to ignore the result and reroll the dice. You must take the second result.
Reveal this card to add 2 to an Intelligence check. You may use another item on this check.
Heavy Armor Magic

Recharge this card to reduce damage dealt to you by 3. Banish this card to reduce all damage dealt to you to 0; if you are proficient with heavy armors, discard this card instead. If you are proficient with heavy armors, you may recharge this card when you reset your hand.

For your combat check, recharge this card and discard a spell to roll your Strength or Melee die + 2d12. If you aren't proficient with weapons, the difficulty of this check is incrased by 4. Reveal this card to add 2 to an Intelligence check. You may use another item on this check.
Recharge this card to add 1d6+1 to your Arcane or Divine check; if it is a combat check, also add the Fire trait. Discard this card to explore your current location.

Discard this card and choose a dead character. His player shuffles 10 of his buried cards at random into his character deck and draws a new hand. The character is no longer dead. If you do not have the Divine skill, banish this card.
Succeed at a Divine 14 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.
Bury this card to examine the top 5 cards of a location deck and put them back in any order.
Place this card next to the Spires of Xin-Shalast adventure card. In each scenario of that adventure, add 2d4 to a check made in an encounter with a bane with the Transmuter trait.
Recharge this card to add 1d6+1 with the Poison trait to your Melee combat check. Discard this card to explore your current location.
Recharge this card to allow every character at your location to shuffle 1 random card from her discard pile into her deck. Discard this card to explore your location.

When you play a spell with the Attack trait, you may reveal this card and discard a spell to add 1d8+2 to your check. If you succeed at the check, recharge a random card from your discard pile. Reveal this card and discard a spell to roll your Arcane die and decrease the difficulty of another character's combat check at your location by that amount.

For your combat check, discard this card to draw a random monster from the box. Use the drawn card's highest difficulty to defeat as the result of your check, then banish the drawn card. No other cards or powers may be used on this check. If you fail the check the monster is undefeated but deals 0 damage.
Succeed at an Arcane or Divine 12 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.
Discard this card to explore your location; add 2d6 to your combat checks during this exploration.

For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Dexterity or Ranged die + 1d10+2; you may additionally discard this card to add another 1d12 with the Poison trait. If you aren't proficient with weapons, the difficulty of this check is increased by 4. If you are proficient with weapons, you may discard this card to add 1d4+2 with the Poison trait to a combat check at another location.
Bury this card on your turn to examine your location deck until you find a weapon, an item, or an armor; shuffle the location deck and put that card on top.
Succeed at an Arcane 8 check to recharge this card instead of burying it.

If you played a weapon with the 2-handed trait on this check, you may not play this card. Reveal this card to reduce Combat damage dealt to you by 2. If you are proficient with light armors, you may play another armor on this check. Discard this card to move to another location at the end of your turn.
If there are no more than 3 cards in your location deck, banish this card to encounter each of them in turn. Discard this card to explore your location.
Monster 3 Barrier 2 Weapon 1 Spell 1 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 0
You may not play spells.
Bury your hand.
On closing, each character at this location takes 1 Force damage.
Where the walls of this complex are not horribly scorched and soot-stained, they depict bejeweled wizards countering the spells of their rivals and firing back with all manner of arcane death.
You may not play spells.
Monster 3 Barrier 1 Weapon 0 Spell 2 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 1 Blessing 1
You may play no more than 1 card per check, regardless of type.
Succeed at a Constitution or Fortitude 12 check.
No effect.

A nauseating bouquet of septic smells rises from the churning canals that ooze amid this labyrinth of smeared tunnels. Here and there strange currents slip through the slime, suggesting either that some ages-old magic constantly stirs the grotesque rivers or that things better left unnamed swim unseen through the putrid channels.
Monster 6 Barrier 0 Weapon 3 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 0 Ally 0 Blessing 0
The difficulty of any combat check is increased by 2. If you fail a combat check, the damage dealt to you is increased by 2.
Succeed at an Intelligence or Knowledge 12 check.
No effect.

Towering iron statues armed with deadly weapons, circles etched with arcane runes, and long, deep gouges scar the walls of these halls, which have more in common with a battlefield than a sanctuary for wizards. Among the brutal decor is a prominent mural of a heavily armored woman wielding a flaming ranseur and riding on a massive red dragon
Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 0 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 2 Ally 2 Blessing 2
Add 2 to your checks to acquire allies. If you fail to acquire an ally, bury an ally from your hand, if you have one.
Succeed at a Charisma or Diplomacy 12 check.
No effect.

This opulent cathedral boasts a ceiling depicting all manner of carnal acts, supported by pillars carved in the likeness of a beautiful, nude woman. At the center of the room, walls of wavering silken sheets create a tent-like enclosure reminiscent of some exotic seraglio. The sounds of unbridled pleasure emanating from within reinforce the impression--or are those gasps of pain?
Monster 2 Barrier 2 Weapon 0 Spell 1 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 2
While you are here, your hand size is increased by 2.
Succeed at a Wisdom or Survival 12 check.
No effect.
Ten grinning skulls gripping bits of flesh in their teeth stare from the walls of this circular chamber. Through sturdy stone doors rumble the sounds of endless slurping and gnashing.
While you are here, your hand size is increased by 2.
Monster 0 Barrier 0 Weapon 0 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 0 Ally 0 Blessing 0
You may not start the scenario here or move here until all other locations are permanently closed.
You may close this location automatically.
Closing this location ends the scenario.

The seven wings of Runeforge radiate out from this domed, central chamber--an eighth tunnel extending back to the entrance. At the hall's heart stands a pool of bubbling prismatic liquid radiating a strange light. This eerie magical light reflects upon the gigantic statues of seven glowering archmages, one grim guardian standing sentinel over each of the seven halls.
Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 1 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 1 Blessing 1
When you succeed at a check, recharge a card.
Succeed at a Wisdom or Perception 12 check.
On closing, you may put any of your buried cards back in your hand.

Floor-to-ceiling mirrors line this brightly lit corridor, giving the impression that it extends into an infinity of repeating realities. Yet as faces and motions reflect in the shimmering walls, certain details seem slightly off--clothies and accessories appear out of place, movements happen a moment out of step, and features take on a resentful cast.
Monster 0 Barrier 0 Weapon 0 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 0 Ally 0 Blessing 0
Characters may not move to or explore the Sihedron Circle until all Stone Head locations are closed. When all Stone Head locations are closed, all characters move to the Sihedron Circle.

Near the snowy banks of Rimeskull lake rises a ledge dominated by seven ominious monoliths. Each of the seven massive stones are sculpted in the shape of a howling face, scarred by weather and age, with an expression that shrieks the pain of countless centuries of exposure. Freezing winds blowing through the broken cliffs gives voice to these immortal cries.
Monster 1 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 1 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 0
Defeating a Henchman here automatically closes this location.
All characters here move to an open location of their choice. When all Stone Head locations are closed, all characters move to the Sihedron Circle.

Near the snowy banks of Rimeskull lake rises a ledge dominated by seven ominious monoliths. Each of the seven massive stones are sculpted in the shape of a howling face, scarred by weather and age, with an expression that shrieks the pain of countless centuries of exposure. Freezing winds blowing through the broken cliffs gives voice to these immortal cries.
Monster 2 Barrier 0 Weapon 1 Spell 1 Armor 1 Item 4 Ally 0 Blessing 0
If you acquire an item, banish another item from your hand, if you have one.
Succeed at a Wisdom or Perception 12 check.
On closing, examine all remaining cards in this deck. You may exchange any of these cards for any cards of the same type in your hand.

A tunnel of polished wood inlaid with gold and silver runes ends at a wall of greenish mist sparkling with silver motes of light. Dozens of precious stones form hypnotic patterns within the glistening walls, but no matter the gemstone's color, each reflects a hint of sinister crimson. The mist in the distance seems to call to you, drawing you into its depths.

The defeat of its leaders has thrown Runeforge into disarray. Vanquish the vicious warriors of wrath--including their leader, Highlady Athroxis--and a living effigy of the Runelord of Greed, then combine the collected magic of Runeforge's masters into weapons of incredible power!
Runeforge Hub Halls of Wrath Iron Cages of Lust Shimmering Veils of Pride Ravenous Crypts of Gluttony Festering Maze of Sloth Vault of Greed

When setting up this scenario, put the villain Karzoug Statue in the location Runeforge Hub. Add henchmen to the other locations as usual.
If you defeat a henchman but do not close the location, shuffle the henchman back into the location deck.
Karzoug Statue
Highlady Athroxis Warrior of Wrath
Loot: Runeforged Weapons

Boththe Scribbler's lair and the library beneath Jorgenfist told of a bastion of Thassilonian magic known as the Runeforge. Travel to the frosty, dragon-stalked shores of the lake called Rimeskull and use the magic of the monolithic stone heads there to open the passage within!
Sihedron Circle Stone Head Stone Head Stone Head Stone Head Stone Head Stone Head Stone Head
To set up this scenario, surround the location Sihedron Circle with 7 "Stone Head" location decks as described on the Sihedron Circle. Put Arkrhyst alone in the Sihedron Circle location.
Stone Heads
Each character chooses a type of boon other than loot and draws a random non-Basic, non-Elite card of that type from the box.

The evil might of Thassilon has been revealed, and Sandpoint sits upon one of its more fiendish ruins. To combat the resurrection of this dark nation of sin-obsessed wizards, Sandpoint's heroes must scour the town of its haunted ruins, then travel to the dragon-guarded shores of Rimeskull. There, they'll infiltrate the ancient Thassilonian laboratory of Runeforge, face its seven sinful branches and their timeless magical guardians, and claim the power of runeforged weapons for their own.
Underneath Sandpoint Rimeskull The Halls of Seduction Thassilonian Sins Into the Runeforge
Each character gains a card feat

The other sinful wings of Runeforge branch off from a central hub circled by statues of Thassilon's forgotten rulers. Hunt down the megalomaniacal masters of the labyrinth, put their ages-old tyranny to an end, and liberate their sinister treasures so you can claim their united powers!
Ravenous Crypts of Gluttony Festering Maze of Sloth Vault of Greed Shimmering Veils of Pride Abjurant Halls of Envy Thassilonian Dungeon Throne Room Desecrated Vault

When a villain is defeated and cannot escape, put it next to this card; any characters at that villain's previous location may immediately move.
To win this scenario, all three villains must be next to this card.
Xyoddin Xerriock Simulacrum of Vraxeris
Loot: Staff of Hungry Shadows, Summon Monster, Ordikon's Staff

The seven wings of Runeforge are each controlled by powerful adherents of Thassilon's deadly sin magic. Within the wing devoted to the sin of lust, the sadistic Mistress Delvahine seeks to control all who trespass upon Runeforge's halls.
Iron Cages of Lust Shimmering Veils of Pride Academy Throne Room Temple Garrison Prison Abjurant Halls of Envy
If you acquire an ally, reset your hand and end your turn.
Mistress Delvahine
Alu-Demon Sisters
Each character gains a power feat.

An ageless evil festers in ruins hidden beneath the streets of Sandpoint. Awaked by the goblin raid long past, the undying cultist called the Scribbler has been restored and is ready to use the power of the demon-goddess Lamashtu to claim lives once more!
Shrine to Lamashtu Garrison Thassilonian Dungeon Town Square The Old Light Sandpoint Cathedral Halls of Wrath Prison
When you permanently close a location, you must succeed at a Wisdom or Divine 8 check or reset your hand and end your turn.
The Scribbler
Hound of Lamashtu
Loot: Fanged Falchion, Revelation Quill
